newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil bolsas had August $466.1 mln capital inflow.
newsitem.headline: Brazil bolsas had August $466.1 mln capital inflow.

text.p: Net foreign capital inflows into Brazilian bourses under Annex Four rules totalled $466.1 million in August, against outflows of $178.3 million in July, Brazil's Securities and Exchange Commission (CVM) said.
The Annex Four regulates investment in Brazilian shares, debentures and privatization bonds.
CVM said in a statement August capital inflows amounted to $1.724 billion against total outflows of $1.258 billion for the month.
So far this year, capital inflows have totalled $1.774 billion.
Foreign investment portfolios totalled $24.06 billion in August, the statement added.
